section.title: Envelope
section.para: This pattern effect allows you to visually edit the pattern editor value columns.

section.title: Usage
section.para: Select a column by double clicking on it, or select a range in the column by clicking and dragging with the mouse. After you have the selection, right click on the pattern editor and select "Envelope". This will invoke the envelope editor displayed below.

If there was data already in the selection, the envelope editor will attempt to re-create an envelope from it. This process involves first adding a point for each rows' value to the envelope. After that, the envelope is pruned to remove points that are linear interpolations of the points on both sides of them. This means basically that if a point is an average of the points on boths sides, it will be deleted. This does not remove any information since that point does not contain any new information not present in the points that are its' neighbors. It also makes the envelope clearer and easier to edit. Please note however, that due to the limited resolution of the tracker column format, after you apply an envelope to a column and then reconstruct it using the envelope editor later, the two envelopes won't always (most of the time) be the same. They will, hopefully, be similar enough though.
